review:
Honestly, Overwatch is just good. It's always scratched an itch that no other game has. The move to 5v5 was good because 6v6 was just becoming too grindy. It's punchy and faster paced now.

The dysfunction at Blizzard has hindered Overwatch's development, but I don't think it's killed it.

im addicted and only play it now bc of my addiction. don't start now if you are new its not worth.

You committed the ultimate cardinal sin, you got personal. You, as a team of professionals trying to make money, got personal. You got personal and decided to insult your playbase, calling us "ass-hats" and "freeloaders". Not a wise move.

We won't forget this. You've set a new tone for the kind of interaction we'll be having with you. It's a cold one. One where there aren't any illusions about the reality of the situation. Previous notions of "family" are dead. We are mere consumers to you, and that is obvious.

You have chosen to bring in a new era of hostility and bitterness. Well done. Great PR move.
Estoy expresando disconformidad con el manejo de este juego, y es todo lo que voy a decir al respecto.

[h1] I used to enjoy this game and now it just wants me to spend more money[/h1]

Before Overwatch added a 2 at the end of it and cancelled its promised PvE mode, I had fun playing with a group of friends, sometimes got a bit much but at least but the game I enjoyed and had some pretty fun moments in is also still here. I just wish I wasn't being forced into grinding a battlepass and slogging through 35 matches won on a specific role to unlock 1 singular hero. This game as of now feels like a chore that I have to spend money on just to keep up with in terms of heros and the skins.

The pressure to spend money in this game is just shoved in your face and it sucks. The game is still fun, the colourfulness and characters I do enjoy are here, it's just new business practices and exploitation to force you into handing over your wallet just for a new battlepass every 3 months, a new hero, more skins to buy, it's the wrong way to approach it and this game seriously lost it's way when they announced it was going free to play after enjoying it now and then with my group of friends on Battlenet. 

I'll probably attempt playing this with friends now and then but aside from that, I've got other games worth my time.

Don't give this game your money, don't indulge, just be ready for a slog of progression if you're planning on sticking being free to play with Overwatch 2.

[h1] Games worth your time and money [/h1]

Here are some games I suggest trying if you want a fun team based experience that won't gouge your wallet for all its worth.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/548430/Deep_Rock_Galactic/

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1286320/Exoprimal/

https://store.steampowered.com/app/440/Team_Fortress_2/

This game is a shell of its former self. Not only is this game a massive cash-grab, but Blizzard pushing the game to the steam platform in an attempt to push the game to a new consumer base is, in and of itself, a cash grab. They backpedaled on promises, changed to an awful business model (BattlePass, go figure), and still don't know how to properly balance the game.

That's just the issues with Overwatch itself. Blizzard themselves are even worse. They have pedophiles working in their company, an employee stole BREAST MILK out of the break room fridge, all this on top of the massive wave of allegations to their employees. This company and its products are nothing but wallet sucking parasites and you shouldn't give them a dime.
Blizzard sucks, game sucks, but I at least have to thank them for my monke

Goofy ahh game is now on Steam

Do I still actively play this game? Yes, I hate myself!

This game is still going hard after all this time. The community loves and keeps it alive. The added PVE adds so much to an already great experience. I always come back and play it. The developers even listened to the fans and fixed it after the fans spoke up. TF2 sure is an amazing game... Oh wait WRONG game


Yeah Overwatch 2 is a house on fire with people burning to death on the inside

3,186 hours and counting on this game between PS4 and PC, and I haven't been happy for a single one. This game being put on Steam for free just now after being on life support since 2020 is Blizzard's one way of truly showing how dire the situation is to keep players in Overwatch. I [b]want[/b] to love this game after spending years of my life on it casually and in Collegiate Esports. 

I've made many friends through this game, and I can at least appreciate that. I would be okay with just telling myself "eh game bad now" and walking away, but it seems Blizzard is in agreeance with this sentiment. It's like they don't enjoy the game anymore either! This past year, they've shown us all kinds of tricks up their sleeves that send this game further and further down the death spiral. They cancelled the PvE mode (7 years in development at that point btw)  that could have brought this game back into the spotlight it had in 2016, just to "resurrect it" with a fraction of the content it was originally going to have and and even higher price tag than the original PvE was going to have! Absolutely baffling decisions in that office...  

Between the addition of mediocre battle passes and taking away legacy features from OW1 and bringing them back like they'e brand new (sometimes with another price tag), it's tough to even login [b]once[/b] per season just to see what terrible batch of cosmetics and half-baked events they've come up with next. It's so pitiful I can't even laugh at the situation, I can only watch it crumble more from the sidelines while playing better games. 

If a veteran tells you "this game is bad" or to "stay away from this pile of shit", you have to believe them.

Finally writing a review on this mess of a game. This review comes from someone who's been playing since the 2015 beta. 

First of all, shoutout to Blizz support for banning my original account because my little brother was talking shit in text chat, meanwhile you got dudes with racial slurs in their names running free. (I know because half of my old OW clanmates are still online on their accounts.) I guess they tolerate racism and stealing maternal milk, but writing "in this world you either cream or get creamed" is too far. 

'Sides that, they turned what once was one of the best competitive hero shooters into a micro-transaction hell, people like to complain about Destiny and COD, but not even they dare to pull sh*t like this. 20 dollars for a single skin? A "freemium" currency that will get you an almost decade old legendary skin and that's it? Got rid of 300+ lootboxes just to give me a virtual gamestop coupon in return? They cancel the supposed PVE campaign, yknow, the whole point of OW2, just to give us another 3 watered down missions that will get boring after the 2nd clear. 

And i'd understand the price of the PVE content if i was a F2P player, but considering a lotta people paid full price for this game when it launched originally, and now they want more money? 

So yeah, download the game and play it if you want, but if you spend a single dime on this game, either on the BP, a skin or the now expensive PVE missions, you have no right to complain about the state of the game ever. You are paying to get robbed and you deserve it.
No me puedo coger a Torbjorn

Overwatch 2's Steam page is like a WikiHow article called [b]"How to get scammed"[/b]

>Non-refundable DLC, with prices ranging from 5$ to 40$
>Spend money, purchase DLC (big mistake)
>Launch the game
>Not recieve the contents of said purchased DLC
>Get scammed with no way to get your money back
i downloaded the game to see if it had become good, spoiler: no
